reviews.review: 너와 나와 그대는 같고 세상은 돌고돌아 제자리를 찾아간다.

BioShock: Infinite closes the book on the BioShock trilogy with its new groundbreaking narrative and modern gameplay. Despite being the latest game in the series, however, it plots back chronologically in a superb effort to connect the overlapping BioShock story. At first glance Infinite does not look like a BioShock game; its colourful and vibrant, the exact opposite of its predecessor games and their Rapture setting. And although this may throw some newcomers off at first, Infinite is in fact more BioShock than anything before it.

Personally, I found BioShock: Infinite to be my favourite in the series. The explored relationship between our two protagonists, Booker and Elizabeth, only grows stronger and more complex as the game progresses. Despite the game leading into other arcs, I believe Infinite's core values is what these characters explore in each other. This is a form of development and connection we could not experience in the previous BioShock games due to the lack of characters we could cling on or relate to. Infinite grasps at our ways of old and challenges the player to think outside of the mindset they are usually in, in their day-to-day lives. Granted, despite how amazing I believe this game is, it definitely is not perfect. The lack of a weapon wheel and the step back from BioShock 2's ergonomically stunning gameplay are the two major downfalls of BioShock: Infinite. Of course these changes force the player to strategize differently from how they are used to, but they are not welcomed changes. It is for these reasons I would instead rate BioShock: Infinite a 9/10.
Terrible controls, UI and shooting.

I think this game is a little overrated, but it is a fun and unique shooter nonetheless. The story is okay. Not really a sequel to Bioshock. It's more-so a spiritual successor. The gameplay is a lot of fun and rewards you greatly for exploration. Getting to experiment with different weapons and VIgors is a blast as well, and it creates great replay value. Murder of Crows and Undertow for the win!

By far my favorite game on any platform--I have played it on xbox 360 when it originally came out and now the remastered and updated versions on xbox one and pc. Overall, while the first few times playing the game were the most awe-inspiring, playing it on the pc with the ability to see all the minute details the graphics of xbox obfuscate has been amazing. So, if you're a fan of the Bioshock trilogy I'd definitely recommend gettin it for pc because there is a whole ton of various details you can miss without the ability to see the graphic settings to ultra.

The combat and all its intricacies is what kept me coming back to this game; the bang of the bullets, the shrieks of the music with a headshot, the amazing sound effects of the special enemies; all wrapped up with a beautiful art style that still holds up today. I could spend an hour just gunning up the patriots and firemen in a sandbox. Even if the ai is pretty lackluster.

与07年的生化奇兵1相比无限并没有那么的恐怖，但是这也能让更多的玩家更容易接受。IGN只给这款游戏评分9.5分，要我评的话我肯定打满分，可我毕竟不是一个洽着薯片坐在沙发上玩电脑的200多斤的肥宅（IGN），另外一个9.5分的原因可能是碍于13年的电脑硬件吧，画面在现在看来也是十分地亮丽清新给人一种身临其境的感觉。剧情的走向确实在开头有点难以捉摸，不过到了后来也都说的通了。大鸟和生化1的彩蛋让我激动地说不出话来。

最后——伊丽莎白天下第一。
很感谢那些把这款游戏做出来的人，我能遇见这款游戏，实在是太好了。从第一部开始，一直到无限，这是一个让人难以忘怀，令人回味的故事。打折的时候别错过哦，不会让你失望的。

바이오쇼크 1,2 를 둘다 플레이하지 않았던 유저입니다.
75% 세일 할때 바쇽1,2, dlc, 바쇽 인피니트, 인피니트 dlc 까지 전부 합쳐서 $16에 세일 하는 걸 보고 
바로 질러서 바이오쇼크 인피니트만 dlc 까지 전부 깼고 그 리뷰만 해보겠습니다. 

바이오쇼크 인피니트를 플레이하기 전에 바쇽1,2 의 배경지식이 없으신 분들이라면 유튜브에 한시간 이상으로 스토리 정리 되어있는 바이오쇼크 1,2 스토리 정리를 보고 플레이 하는걸 권장합니다.
프리퀄이라고 하기는 해도 바쇽1,2 스토리를 알아야 이해되는 것들이 많아요. 반가운 것들도 있구요
특히 DLC 바다의 무덤은 바쇽1,2 를 플레이하지 않았지만 스토리만 찾아봤던 저로서도 온몸에 소름이 돋을정도로 너무 재밌었습니다. 다만 인피니트에서 공포감이 확 줄었다고들 하시는데 인피니트 자체만으로도 저는 충분히 무서웠습니다. ㅠㅜ
그래서 인피니트를 다 깬 시점에서 바쇽 1,2를 건들기가 좀 두렵네요.

플레이타임은 인피니트, 인피니트 dlc 바다의 무덤 1화, 2화 이 세개 전부 합쳐서 13시간 정도 나왔구 저는 세일해서 사서 그런지는 몰라도 매우 만족입니다. 30불 정도였어도 만족 했을 것 같아요

И, наконец, Элизабет — один из лучших (и точно самый симпатичный) напарников в истории игр. Прекрасная визуальная составляющая и проработанные локации.Эта игра стоит твоего внимания .

Irrational did it again. [b] Immersion [/b] like nothing else and a world unlike any other.

Despite taking mechanics from the previous Bioshock games such as Vigors (Plasmids), Handymen (Big Daddies) etc, the game feels fresh and original unlike anything else. 
The world of Columbia is a stark contrast to the City of Rapture, just as it is meant to be. 
Rapture was claustrophobic, dark and dank exactly as one would imagine an underwater city to be but Columbia feels open and airy, the city painted by bright colours and it's people dressed in beautiful clothing. Buildings keep bobbing up and down, giving you the sense of a city that's floating in the air and the NPCs are dressed in beautiful timely clothing. The interiors of the city are even more astounding and I found myself reading up on the lore continously whenever I wasn't playing and had a bit of free time. 

The [u] gameplay [/u] is goddamn amazing. Having played the previous two Bioshock games on my console when I was a kid, I can confidently say that Infinite had the best shooting mechanics and the best Vigor/Plasmid mechanics as well out of all three games. Irrational took their formula and bettered it in every manner imaginable and it had me going back to the Clash in the Clouds DLC to get my dosage of the combat after I finished the story missions itself.

Elizabeth as a companion and as a character was done beautifully. She has her own story arc which was amazing and gameplay-wise, she's the best. She throws you ammunition when you're low (which has been a lifesaver for me on more than one occasion), money from time to time and she can open up "tears" in areas, giving you a much needed box of ammunition or healthpack or bringing a turret that could help you thin out the herd of enemies you're facing up against. And on top of all those amazing things, you don't have to worry about her at all while in combat. 
[b] Elizabeth is INVINCIBLE and CANNOT be killed which means no QT events during combat to save her and no having to look out for her which gives you much more freedom while fighting. [/b]

The [u] story [/u] is umm... very unusual.
I saw a video by Crowbcat on YouTube (https://youtu.be/muJYTeQlvC4) and it showed how much we missed out on, how many ideas Irrational had but could not include in the end product and it made me sad over how much we missed out. That being said, the story is still amazing and I am definitely going to play the entire game again on the highest difficulty. 

Overall, I'd definitely recommend this game to everyone who enjoys story-based single player games and it's a must have for every system, especially considering the dirt-cheap price that Steam is selling it for.

You cannot say this game was released back in 2013. The graphics and the art style are amazing. The gameplay is enjoyable. The plot is really on another whole new level. If you played the original Bioshock and Bioshock Infinite + the 2 dlc episodes, you will see how well written the plot and the story as a whole is. But you don't need to have played anything else. I haven't and I enjoyed the game a lot. I promise you, if you like nice gameplay with cool visuals and mind-boggling story, you are likely to enjoy this game.
